abstract: Some lawmakers want to repeal a provision in the Dodd-Frank law that exempts the agency from certain disclosures.
snippet: Some lawmakers want to repeal a provision in the Dodd-Frank law that exempts the agency from certain disclosures.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Securities and Exchange Commission is fighting attempts by some lawmakers to repeal a provision in a new law that gives the commission greater ability to block public disclosure of material it gathers from financial and investment firms.

headline.main: S.E.C. Defends Exemptions in New Law
headline.print_headline: S.E.C. Defends Exemptions in New Law

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
